title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 29 January 2014 - XWiki
content:
<GuillaumeF> has quit  
00:07 <mflorea> has quit  
00:27 <abusenius> has quit  
04:30 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
06:01 <Denis> has quit  
07:15 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
07:53 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:03 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:12 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:16 <vmassol> has quit  
08:26 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
08:27 <polx> has quit  
08:28 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:51 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
09:04 <mstaicu> has joined #xwiki  
09:07 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:08 <mstaicu> question about http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/HIERARCHYM-1 , the macro shouldn't display hidden documents? I don't understand "This macro doesn't not obey Hidden Docs"  
09:09 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:17 <DarkKnightCZ> what is the correct way to obtain documents with specified class and with comparsion of its properties? hql example (StringProperty as prop where prop.id.id = obj.id and prop.id.name='nameofproperty') returns zero rows although that class has that property  
09:28 <evalica> has quit  
09:34 <mstaicu> I think you need to specify a value as well  
09:34 <mstaicu> Getting documents where objects' properties equals some value #set($hql = "select doc.fullName from XWikiDocument doc, BaseObject obj, StringProperty prop where doc.fullName=obj.name and obj.className='XWiki.XWikiUsers' and prop.id.id=obj.id and prop.name='first\_name' and prop.value='Jean-Vincent'")  
09:35 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:36 <vmassol> has quit  
09:36 <DarkKnightCZ> hmm, and how to compare date type in hql? (or rather how is it stored)  
09:36 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:37 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:39 <mstaicu> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/velocityHqlExamples I hope this is not outdated, you have the date comparision section there. It's a bit strange in HQL  
09:46 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
09:47 <DarkKnightCZ> well, that's for document (i guess its stored as datetime/date in database), but in property it will be stored somehow else, i cannot compare it this way  
09:56 <DarkKnightCZ> ok, so i cannot compare it because its missing from select... "select prop.name, prop.value, doc.fullName from XWikiDocument doc, BaseObject obj, StringProperty prop where doc.fullName=obj.name and obj.className='Space.Class' and prop.id.id=obj.id"  returns only properties of types String and Static List (no textarea, date, number)  
09:57 <DarkKnightCZ> oh, DateProperty :)  
09:57 <mstaicu> :)  
10:55 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
11:09 <DarkKnightCZ> how can i access current request in groovy?  
11:09 <vmassol> request  
11:09 <vmassol> :)  
11:10 <DarkKnightCZ> yep, thanks :)  
11:15 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Scripting#HBindings  
11:16 <tmortagne> (same for all scripting languages)  
11:17 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:25 <tmortagne> ok so no open issue tagged for 5.4RC1 left but http://ci.xwiki.org is totally unusable  
11:25 <vmassol> has someone restarted it?  
11:26 <tmortagne> no idea  
11:26 <tmortagne> I was about to look at it  
11:26 <vmassol> restarting  
11:34 <tmortagne> java.lang.NullPointerException  
11:34 <vmassol> wow  
11:34 <vmassol> doing again  
11:35 <tmortagne> jenkins is really not in a very good shape these days, lost js/css yesterday and now this  
11:35 <vmassol> probably some issues on the FS somewhere  
11:36 <tmortagne> 503G available on FS so it's not that at least  
11:36 <vmassol> yeah I checked disk space  
11:36 <vmassol> someone needs to check permissions maybe  
11:38 <ClemensR> something completely different: is the "Extended Todo application" in xwiki-commons and I just do not find it, or is it just maintained on a ad hoc basis: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Extended+Todo+Application  
11:39 <vmassol> it's not in commons  
11:39 <vmassol> it's created by a contributor  
11:39 <vmassol> mrawash  
11:39 <vmassol> and it's not on xwiki-contrib apparently  
11:39 <vmassol> if you're interested you could contact him and port it to xwiki-contrib  
11:39 <tmortagne> ClemensR: why did you expected it on xwiki-commons ?  
11:40 <ClemensR> just asking if it is, as I need to update it to 5.x for some folks asking for it  
11:40 <tmortagne> vmassol: not sure who is "him", http://main.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/mrawash does not exist  
11:41 <tmortagne> anymore  
11:41 <tmortagne> looks like it's been deleted  
11:42 <ClemensR> niot sure if that app is the right way into the future, so maybe I just update it until it is "good enough" and upload the next version to to e.x.o, like Marius did for the last versions  
11:43 <tmortagne> ClemensR: I think now it would be done using AppWithinMinutes  
11:43 <tmortagne> maybe http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Task+Manager+Application cover your use case  
11:43 <ClemensR> yes, me too, except that folks have about 100 old existing ToDos that they do not want to loose  
11:44 <tmortagne> ok  
11:47 <vmassol> ClemensR: since the license is LGPL you can fork it on xwiki-contrib  
11:47 <vmassol> and continue the work there  
11:48 <vmassol> (if you want)  
11:48 <vmassol> and release a newer version  
11:48 <ClemensR>  well, me just wondering which one of the Todo applications is the "most maintained" one ;)  
11:48 <vmassol> ahah that's always an issue :)  
11:48 <ClemensR> for the first attempt I will just update the version on e.x.o  
11:49 <vmassol> once you know, would be great to edit them with some info box to explain the pros and cons of each ;)  
11:50 <vmassol> tmortagne: ci is back for a while  
11:50 <tmortagne> yep just seen it  
11:50 <vmassol> let's hurry up to release :)  
11:50 <tmortagne> not according to jenkins state  
11:51 <vmassol> triggered rendering  
11:59 <tmortagne> mflorea: any idea what could cause http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/lastBuild/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui.appwithinminutes/UserClassFieldTest/testSingleSelection/, it does not seems to be a flicker (age 8)  
12:00 <mflorea> no, I need to check locally  
12:21 <vmassol> tmortagne: the css issue on jenkins could be fixed by "Broken CSS when reloading Jenkins after a time of inactivity" in 1.549 (http://jenkins-ci.org/changelog)  
12:22 <vmassol> arf seems they put in the RN but it may not be fixed since the issue isn't closed yet, see last comment of https://issues.jenkins-ci.org/browse/JENKINS-17526  
12:24 <vmassol> acutally code has been committed  
12:25 <vmassol> seems this issue is only on mac osx though  
12:41 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
13:39 <mflorea> tmortagne: I cannot reproduce UserClassFieldTest#testSingleSelection locally, I tried a few times but it always passes..  
13:39 <mflorea> I need to debug it on the agent  
13:40 <tmortagne> mflorea: ok  
13:43 <DarkKnightCZ> document.set("param name","value"); should set value for parameter with that name, right? and document.save() should save it then (xwiki.api.Document)... if this is correct, why cannot i see the change? (no changes, no modified params, no errors)  
13:45 <gdelhumeau> I personaly always do object.set() instead of document.set()  
13:50 <DarkKnightCZ> hmm, still no change  
13:52 <DarkKnightCZ> Date param is java.util.Date, right?  
13:55 <DarkKnightCZ> hmm, its changed (if i print it), it just doesn't show  
14:02 <DarkKnightCZ> isn't there a bug with Date field? (second one shows same value as first)  
14:06 <DarkKnightCZ> hmm, {{include document="AppWithinMinutes.Date"/}} caused that... i wonder what that is  
14:21 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: any idea or http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-wiki-test-tests/4927/testReport/org.xwiki.wiki.test.ui/WikiTest/createWikiFromTemplate/ ? age 3 so does not looks like a flicker  
14:21 <tmortagne> but maybe jenkins was just lucky  
14:21 <tmortagne> s/or/for/  
14:24 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
14:33 <gdelhumeau> I do not understand  
15:07 <tekzilla> what would be the proper way to downgrade an install ? i've been using the packages from the "releases" branch, uninstalled them and reinstalled from "stable"  
15:08 <tekzilla> now the distribution wizard complains, when asked to downgrade: The extension [com.xpn.xwiki.products:xwiki-enterprise-wiki-5.4-milestone-1] is already installed  
15:08 <gdelhumeau> vmassol is teaching me how to improve my integration test  
15:08 <ClemensR> has quit  
15:09 <tekzilla> reason for downgrade: upgrade to 5.4-milestone1 borked my UI/main page  
15:17 <tmortagne> tekzilla: you are moving from which version to which version exactly ?  
15:25 <tekzilla> tmortagne: from 5.4-milestone1 to 5.3 from the stable repo  
15:26 <tmortagne> so you downgraded the WAR to 5.3 and now it complain saying that "com.xpn.xwiki.products:xwiki-enterprise-wiki-5.4-milestone-1" is already installed ?  
15:26 <tmortagne> where is this message displayed exactly ?  
15:27 <tmortagne> a screenshot would be great  
15:28 <tmortagne> do you get "downgrade" button ?  
15:30 <tmortagne> in any case if you change the WAR to 5.3 it looks like a bug to be so it would be great if you could report an issue on http://jira.xwiki.org  
15:30 <tmortagne> s/be/me/  
15:31 <tekzilla> the message is displayed in the distribution wizard after login  
15:31 <tekzilla> i do get a downgrade button  
15:31 <tmortagne> so you get that after clicking on downgrade ?  
15:31 <tekzilla> i'll make a screenshot of it, will be in german  
15:31 <tekzilla> yes  
15:31 <tmortagne> ok  
15:32 <tmortagne> no need for the scheenshot  
15:32 <tekzilla> ok  
15:32 <tmortagne> I have some idea of what could be the issue but it's not a quickfix, would be great if you could create an issue on http://jira.xwiki.org  
15:33 <tekzilla> ok i'll do that  
15:33 <tmortagne> as for the workaround all I can think of is downgrade one by one all the 5.4-milestone-1 extension in Extension Manager  
15:33 <tmortagne> so skip the DW  
15:34 <tekzilla> ok didnt know i could just skip over it  
15:34 <tekzilla> would it be possible to just downgrade the problematic extension (in this case it seems to be the wiki core?) and run the wizard again for the rest ?  
15:34 <tmortagne> but downgrade all one them one by one is not going to be an painless task (if that even work or all of them)  
15:35 <tmortagne> tekzilla: xwiki-enterprise-wiki is the top level extension for the UI  
15:35 <tmortagne> it's not just some extension  
15:36 <tmortagne> mflorea: do we have downgrade UI tests for EM ?  
15:36 <mflorea> I think we do  
15:36 <tmortagne> I think I remember one but not sure  
15:37 <mflorea> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/blob/master/xwiki-enterprise-test/xwiki-enterprise-test-extension/src/test/it/org/xwiki/test/ui/extension/ExtensionTest.java#L787  
15:37 <tekzilla> so why is the 5.4 version of the extension even still present, i removed all xwiki packages (leaving config and DB in place) before reinstalling 5.3  
15:38 <tmortagne> tekzilla: xwiki-enterprise-wiki is not a jar  
15:38 <tekzilla> ah ok the pages get imported into the database ?  
15:38 <tmortagne> yes  
15:38 <tmortagne> so xwiki-enterprise-wiki and its dependencies are the pages you have in your wikis  
15:39 <tmortagne> s/wikis/wiki/  
15:39 <tmortagne> but I don't know why it does not want to to do the downgrade  
15:40 <tmortagne> anyway with your issue and detailed steps to reproduce we can reproduce and look at it  
15:40 <tekzilla> ok i'll try the manual downgrade then.. or export my stuff and do a clean install  
15:40 <tekzilla> yeah i'll file an issue and report back  
15:40 <tmortagne> sorry about that  
15:42 <tekzilla> no problem! most of the time i love using xwiki, which you provide for free, won't hear me complain :)  
15:44 <tekzilla> and regardless of it being free... humans have bugs -> software has bugs  
15:46 <tmortagne> yep but this one is hard to recover from :)  
15:50 <vmassol> guys (tmortagne, mflorea, gdelhumeau): could you check this list of jiras with issues affecting 5.2.2 or 5.2.3 and that haven't been fixed in 5.2.3 or 5.2.4? I'd like to release a 5.2.4 ASAP but I'd prefer to not forget anything if possible :)  
15:50 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9942?jql=category%20in%20(%22Top%20Level%20Projects%22)%20and%20affectedVersion%20in%20(%225.2.2%22%2C%20%225.2.3%22)%20and%20fixVersion%20not%20in%20(%225.2.4%22%2C%20%225.2.3%22)  
15:52 <tmortagne> vmassol: you link is not a list  
15:52 <vmassol> strange  
15:52 <vmassol> it's a list here  
15:52 <tmortagne> s/you/your/  
15:52 <mflorea> yeah, you need to click on Return to search  
15:53 <vmassol> query is  
15:53 <vmassol> category in ("Top Level Projects") and affectedVersion in ("5.2.2", "5.2.3") and fixVersion not in ("5.2.4", "5.2.3")  
15:53 <tmortagne> sure but you are not in search, you are in  http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9942  
15:53 <vmassol> that's how jira works now tmortagne  
15:53 <tmortagne> vmassol: not really no, the right link is http://jira.xwiki.org/issues/?jql=category%20in%20%28%22Top%20Level%20Projects%22%29%20and%20affectedVersion%20in%20%28%225.2.2%22%2C%20%225.2.3%22%29%20and%20fixVersion%20not%20in%20%28%225.2.4%22%2C%20%225.2.3%22%29  
15:53 <vmassol> it'll take the url of the first issue of the list  
15:53 <vmassol> click on an issue  
15:54 <vmassol> the jql is still there  
15:54 <mflorea> I don't think XWIKI-9788 is that importnat for 5.2.4.  
15:54 <tmortagne> sure but it's not a list...  
15:54 <mflorea> I'll merge only XWIKI-9858  
15:54 <vmassol> maybe there's a context  
15:54 <vmassol> I see a list locally when I enter this url  
15:55 <msmeria> has quit  
15:55 <vmassol> tmortagne: when I click on your link  
15:55 <vmassol> I get the following displayed in my url bar:  
15:55 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9942?jql=category%20in%20(%22Top%20Level%20Projects%22)%20and%20affectedVersion%20in%20(%225.2.2%22%2C%20%225.2.3%22)%20and%20fixVersion%20not%20in%20(%225.2.4%22%2C%20%225.2.3%22)  
15:55 <tmortagne> I don't thing wikistream issues are blocker for 5.2 branch  
15:55 <vmassol> seems it redirects internally  
15:55 <vmassol> agreed  
15:58 <vmassol> sburjan: do you want to test the issues marked as fixed for 5.2.4 before I release it or not?  
16:00 <vmassol> note: myxwiki.org is being restarted  
16:00 <vmassol> (has been restarted)  
16:00 <sburjan> vmassol, : yes, I'd like to do that, yes.  
16:00 <vmassol> ah no, has been restarted  
16:01 <vmassol> sburjan: then do it ASAP since I was asked to release it ASAP and I wanted to start :)  
16:01 <sburjan> vmassol: but I won't finish today. Can you wait until tomorrow evening ?  
16:01 <tmortagne> mflorea: still no idea about org.xwiki.test.ui.appwithinminutes.UserClassFieldTest.testSingleSelection ?  
16:02 <vmassol> sburjan: ok , then I'll probably release next Monday which is probably ok  
16:02 <mflorea> passes on my laptop, but I can reproduce the failure by running the test on CI. I'm trying to connect remotely with VNC to the agent to understand what happens  
16:03 <sburjan> vmassol: yes, Monday sounds good  
16:05 <tmortagne> mflorea: ok  
16:05 <tmortagne> what is wrong exactly from the test point of view when failing ?  
16:05 <mflorea> timeout when waiting for the list of user suggestions  
16:06 <tmortagne> ok  
16:06 <mflorea> for some reason it takes too long, >10s, to get the suggestions  
16:06 <vmassol> mflorea: gdelhumeau's test failure seems to be caused also by an extra long duration  
16:06 <vmassol> his timeout was set to 9s which is already quite long  
16:07 <vmassol> (for provisining an empty wiki with 1 page + mandatory pages)  
16:07 <gdelhumeau> especialy since it takes ~3sec on my own machine  
16:07 <mflorea> but the test fails in various places, i.e. in some place it gets the suggestion in less than 10s, sometimes not  
16:07 <vmassol> he's increased it to 30 s to see if it helps  
16:07 <vmassol> if it does it means there's something wrong, it shouldn' take that long  
16:08 <mflorea> vmassol: I don't know what is happening in gdelhumeau's case but in my case the list of user suggestions should be fetched in less than 1s, especially since there are no more than 3 users..  
16:09 <vmassol> I'm mentioning gd's case because yours and his could come from the same cause  
16:09 <vmassol> (slowness)  
16:10 <vmassol> I agree that increasing the timeouts are not really a good long-term solution it's more like pushing the rubbish under the carpet :)  
16:10 <tmortagne> mflorea: it's an ajax request with no UI that takes that long ?  
16:10 <gdelhumeau> the problem may comes from the machine  
16:11 <gdelhumeau> why is it so slow?  
16:11 <mflorea> I'd like to see how the rest is running, Trying to connect with VNC to the agent (1-3, marked it offline)  
16:11 <vmassol> that's the $1000 dollar question gdelhumeau :)  
16:11 <mflorea> tmortagne: yes, ajax, so it should take that much in any case  
16:11 <tmortagne> yep  
16:12 <mflorea> but it may be something else, digging..  
16:13 <tekzilla> tmortagne: cant get the DW to run again (already removed  jobs/status/distribution/status.xml), will the error message i posted to you suffice for the jira ticket ?  
16:15 <tmortagne> tekzilla: what is important is explanation to reproduce  
16:17 <tekzilla> tmortagne: ok, i will describe it best i can, and after restarting xwiki/tomcat i also get the DW  
16:24 <gdelhumeau> I am thinking about adding a getCreationDate() in wiki descriptors, WDYT?  
16:24 <gdelhumeau> in order to know when a wiki has been created  
16:27 <tekzilla> tmortagne: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XE-1359  
16:28 <tmortagne> tekzilla: thanks  
16:40 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: $services.wiki.lastException still works in 5.4RC1 ?  
16:41 <gdelhumeau> deprecated but yes  
16:41 <tmortagne> so it's not a breakage (i.e. nothing to do in http://main.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki54RC1#HAPIBreakages)  
16:42 <tmortagne> moved it in http://main.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki54RC1#HMiscellaneous-1  
16:43 <DarkKnightCZ> has left #xwiki  
16:56 <Denis> has quit  
16:58 <evalica> has quit  
17:01 <mflorea> tmortagne: I manged to connect with VNC to the agent and it's a test synchronization issue. I need to improve the test. But in any case it's not a problem for the users. I'll try to improve the test.  
17:02 <tmortagne> mflorea: ok, doing some minor stuff like updating the translations and will start maven release tomorrow morning  
17:02 <mflorea> ok  
17:03 <vmassol> tmortagne: we'll need the branches created before the BFD starts though so that we don't commit anything dangerous on 5.4.x  
17:05 <mstaicu> has left #xwiki  
17:06 <mflorea> has quit  
17:16 <the\_codebot> has joined #xwiki  
17:16 <sburjan> has quit  
17:16 <the\_code`> has joined #xwiki  
17:20 <the\_codebot> has quit  
17:25 <the\_code`> has quit  
17:35 <vmassol> tmortagne: commons 6.0 fails to build  
17:35 <vmassol> [ERROR] 7002: org.xwiki.logging.event.LogEvent: Method 'public boolean isBegin()' has been removed  
17:35 <vmassol> [ERROR] 7002: org.xwiki.logging.event.LogEvent: Method 'public boolean isEnd()' has been removed  
17:35 <vmassol> this was added after 5.4M1?  
17:35 <vmassol> s/added/removed  
17:36 <tmortagne> this is because of method added in 5.4M1 and removed in 5.4RC1...  
17:37 <tmortagne> putting back 5.3 for now untill 5.4RC1 is released  
17:37 <cjd> I have a quick question, what is the function for getting a document reference from a name?   $services.reference.somethingOrOther("XWiki.Admin") ?  
17:37 <tmortagne> it's actually $services.model  
17:38 <cjd> $services.model.createDocumentReferenceGivenAStringRepresentationOfADocumentName() ?  
17:38 <cjd> sorry, couldn't help it ;)  
17:39 <tmortagne> resolveDocument  
17:39 <cjd> ahh, thank you  
17:39 <vmassol> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Model+Module  
17:39 <vmassol> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Model+Module#HScriptServiceAPI to be previse  
17:39 <vmassol> \*precise  
17:39 <tmortagne> but if you create a reference because you have a method taking a DocumentReference you can directly give a String which will be automatically converted  
17:39 <vmassol> arg invalid link :)  
17:39 <tmortagne> in velocity at list  
17:40 <vmassol> (for https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/tree/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-model/src/main/java/org/xwiki/model/internal/scripting/ModelScriptService.java ). checking...  
17:41 <cjd> oh cool  
17:41 <cjd> DocumentReference.toString() now returns the cannonical form of the document name?  
17:41 <cjd> xwiki:XWiki.Admin ?  
17:41 <cjd> that's pretty nice, I've been meaning to suggest that  
17:42 <tmortagne> yes but it's not really an API, more  debug feature  
17:42 <cjd> ok gotta go for a lunch meeting, be back in a few hours  
17:42 <tmortagne> the real safe way to get the String version is to use a serializer  
17:52 <vmassol> tmortagne: you changed the wrong place :)  
17:52 <vmassol> should be in <xwiki.clirr.previous.version>  
17:53 <tmortagne> vmassol: did not even wondered why the previous version was 6.0-SNAPSHOT...  
17:53 <tmortagne> thanks for the report  
17:56 <vmassol> note that this commit from gdelhumeau was a merge error  
17:56 <vmassol> he removed the ability to invite users in 5.4M1 by error  
17:57 <gdelhumeau> has quit
